alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 8:47AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Orange, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 AM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deltona, Sanford, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Winter Park, Casselberry, Maitland, Lake Mary, Longwood, Lake Jessup, Geneva, Lockhart, Fern Park, Wekiva Springs, Fairview Shores, Forest City, Eatonville and Sanford Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
